HOURS
Tues-Sat:
Breakfast: 7:00am-10:30am
Tues-Sat:
Lunch: 11:00am-2:00pm
Tues-Thurs:
Dinner: 5:00pm-8:00pm
Fri & Sat:
Dinner: 5:00pm-9:00pm
Closed Sundays
756 Baldwin Ave
Defuniak Springs, FL 32435
850-520-4190
ABOUT US
Sweet Southern Comfort in DeFuniak Springs, Florida, is a cozy, Southern-style restaurant offering a warm and inviting atmosphere that reflects the charm of the area. Open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner—with a brief afternoon closing from 2 to 5 PM—it caters to a wide range of appetites with classic Southern dishes and comforting favorites. The spacious dining area includes well-spaced tables and booths, as well as larger nooks built into oversized front windows, perfect for accommodating groups. The eclectic décor adds personality to the casual setting, while the large, horseshoe-shaped bar invites patrons to relax and catch a game.
The friendly and collaborative staff ensures that every customer feels welcomed and well-cared for. The extensive menu options appeal to a variety of tastes, delivering delicious, homemade Southern cooking. From the perfectly cooked bacon and warm, fluffy biscuits to the Southern-style grits, the Sunrise Breakfast does not disappoint. With a full bar, a great beer list, and affordable pricing, Sweet Southern Comfort has established itself as a hidden gem in Downtown DeFuniak Springs.
CATERING
Book your next catering event or party with us!
BOOK CATERING
REVIEWS
Small newer business with quality food. Younger staff. If you get a chance to try their Oreo dessert do it. I can tell the owners love what they do and I wish them luck. Super clean and fresh atmosphere. I'll go back if I pass through again.
Justin
A really lovely restaurant. We were seated quickly, and our food arrived quickly. I ordered 2 Eggs in a basket, adding bacon and breakfast potatoes. My husband and I shared the hand dipped French toast, and added bananas.
Stephanie
Filet mignon and shrimp scampi were excellent. I'm not a crabcake expert, but these are the first I've had that tasted like crab... in a cake. They even had old glory hanging on the wall, God Bless America!!
Nathan
